title: CPO-funded American Planning Association Book: Planning for Urban Heat Resilience
content:
A green roof beats the heat at the Virginia Living Museum in Newport News. Credit:  Ryan Somma / Wikimedia Commons
A green roof beats the heat at the Virginia Living Museum in Newport News. Credit:  Ryan Somma / Wikimedia Commons
NOAA/NIHHIS Extreme Heat Risk Initiative grantees, Drs. Ladd Keith (University of Arizona) and Sarah Meerow (Arizona State University), have written a first-of-its-kind guidebook for urban planners to manage and mitigate urban heat, published by the American Planning Association (APA). The book will be part of the PAS Report series, which has, for the past 70+ years, offered “comprehensive guidance on important planning issues and innovative practices.”
